alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 209 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 9 miles southwest of Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, or 23 miles west of Pembroke Pines, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27, Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal and West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County
